interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: A Christmas Carol
Review Date: 2015/09/28
Store: Alastair Sim  (Actor),     Hermione Baddely  (Actor),     Brian Desmond Hurst  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Product Description: ['Alastair Sim\'s tour-de-force performance as the ultimate miser, Ebenezer Scrooge, has almost single-handedly made this beloved version of Charles Dickens\' story into one of the best-loved Christmas films of all time. Some of Britain\'s best filmmakers united behind Sim, who was joined by a delightful cast of accomplished and acclaimed English actors; creating what many today believe to be the best and most faithful production of Dickens\' immortal tale. Cranky and curmudgeonly Scrooge learns the error of his unkind ways and is taught the true meaning of the holidays when he is visited by the ghost of his late business partner and the spirits of Christmas past, present and future. Special Features: Commentaries by Marcus Hearn and George Cole; Introduction by Leonard Maltin; "Dead to Begin With: The Darker Side of A Classic"- Explores the movies bleaker themes and how they rivaled London of the 1950\'s - features film historian and culturalist Sir Christopher Frayling; "Scrooge by Another Name: Distributing \'A Christmas Carol\'" - Details the American release of this British holiday classic as told by distributor Richard Gordon; "The Human Blarney Stone: Life and Times of Brian Desmond Hurst"; "The Alastair Sim Version: Too Good To Be Shown Only At Christmastime - video narrative by Fred Guida, author of \'A Christmas Carol and It\'s Adaptations\'; and A collection of early silent versions of Dickens on film.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.25 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25752733', 'Director': 'Brian Desmond Hurst', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, Black & White, Full Screen, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 16, 2012', 'Actors': 'Alastair Sim, Hermione Baddely, Kathleen Harrison, Mervyn Johns, George Cole', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Vci Video', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Wonderful quality for a dated film.  This Christmas Carol film is not to be missed.  It is one of, if not the best of Christmas Carol movies made.
Review Title: A classic for the whole family!!!!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

One truly special bargain

Connie And Carla
Nia Vardalos  (Actor),     Toni Collette  (Actor),     Michael Lembeck  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles
['From the writer and star of My Big Fat Greek Wedding comes Connie and Carla, the hilarious new comedy the Chicago Sun-Times calls "a total delight!" Best friends Connie and Carla have always dreamed of fame and fortune, but their careers in show business are going nowhere fast. After witnessing a crime, they are forced to go on the run and keep their true identities secret. The dazzling duo stumble on an ingenious way to let their many talents shine. Now with a little luck–and lots of beauty products–they\'re going straight to the top, with plenty of side-splitting twists and turns along the way! Connie and Carla is an irresistible comedy-adventure filled with fun and loaded with laughter!Bonus Content:', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Bonus Musical Scenes', 'Bonus Musical Scenes', 'Outtakes', 'Outtakes', 'The Making of Connie and Carla', 'The Making of Connie and Carla', 'Dressing in Drag', 'Dressing in Drag', 'Debbie Reynolds', 'Debbie Reynolds']

A Christmas Carol
Alastair Sim  (Actor),     Hermione Baddely  (Actor),     Brian Desmond Hurst  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD

['Alastair Sim\'s tour-de-force performance as the ultimate miser, Ebenezer Scrooge, has almost single-handedly made this beloved version of Charles Dickens\' story into one of the best-loved Christmas films of all time. Some of Britain\'s best filmmakers united behind Sim, who was joined by a delightful cast of accomplished and acclaimed English actors; creating what many today believe to be the best and most faithful production of Dickens\' immortal tale. Cranky and curmudgeonly Scrooge learns the error of his unkind ways and is taught the true meaning of the holidays when he is visited by the ghost of his late business partner and the spirits of Christmas past, present and future. Special Features: Commentaries by Marcus Hearn and George Cole; Introduction by Leonard Maltin; "Dead to Begin With: The Darker Side of A Classic"- Explores the movies bleaker themes and how they rivaled London of the 1950\'s - features film historian and culturalist Sir Christopher Frayling; "Scrooge by Another Name: Distributing \'A Christmas Carol\'" - Details the American release of this British holiday classic as told by distributor Richard Gordon; "The Human Blarney Stone: Life and Times of Brian Desmond Hurst"; "The Alastair Sim Version: Too Good To Be Shown Only At Christmastime - video narrative by Fred Guida, author of \'A Christmas Carol and It\'s Adaptations\'; and A collection of early silent versions of Dickens on film.']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** Movies, specifically family and holiday-themed films, with a particular emphasis on Christmas content and classic cinema.
- **Genre Preference:** Enjoys romantic comedies and family-friendly films with nostalgic elements, including classic dramas and light-hearted ghost tales; recent engagement with humor suggests an expanding enjoyment of comedic films that bring joy and laughter.
- **Format Preference:** Prefers physical media, particularly DVDs, reflecting a love for traditional viewing experiences that enhance appreciation of classic films.
- **Value-Conscious:** Seeks value in film purchases, looking for high-quality content with lasting appeal and strong emotional resonance, as indicated by enthusiastic ratings and reviews of enjoyable films.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Strong connection to films that evoke personal memories and sentimental feelings, showcasing an emotional affinity for vintage classics.
- **Positive Engagement:** Frequently rates films highly and shares positive insights, demonstrating an appreciation for quality entertainment that resonates emotionally. Recent positive reviews indicate satisfaction with well-produced films, particularly during the holiday season. 

Overall, the user displays a consistent preference for feel-good movies that evoke laughter and nostalgia, enhancing their viewing experience, especially in the context of holiday celebrations.
